intro: Helmia monodelpha, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to bright red. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Helmia monodelpha is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
